intro: Orchis latifolia var. eboracensis, commonly known as the Eboracense Orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the UK, particularly found in damp, calcareous grasslands. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with yellow markings. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a single, showy flower per stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often associated with limestone-rich habitats. This variety is of conservation interest due to its restricted distribution and sensitivity to habitat disturbance.
